item.title: Tamil Nadu governor RN Ravi's action ‘childish’: CM MK Stalin - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi's Actions Criticized by CM MK Stalin

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

The Tamil Nadu chief minister MK Stalin criticized Governor RN Ravi for failing to address the state assembly and called his behavior 'childish'.

  • Stalin stated that RN Ravi seemed unable to accept the state's development.
  • The governor left the assembly without delivering a customary address due to the Tamil anthem not being played.
  • According to Stalin, Ravi’s actions disrespect the assembly and the people of Tamil Nadu.
“This House cannot bear to see the governor doing something with political motives that drags the position and responsibility he held by not respecting the dignity of this Assembly.”

In conclusion, CM Stalin's remarks reflect ongoing tensions between the Tamil Nadu government and the governor's office, highlighting issues of political integrity and respect in legislative procedures.

item.title: Ceiling slab collapses at Kannauj railway station, several feared trapped - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Ceiling Slab Collapse at Kannauj Railway Station: Rescue Operations Underway

Date: Jan 11, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

A major accident occurred at Kannauj railway station when a ceiling slab of an under-construction building collapsed, trapping several workers and railway staff under the debris. Immediate rescue operations were launched.

  • The incident occurred on Saturday while workers were laying the ceiling slab.
  • Approximately 40 people were present on-site; 23 have been rescued so far.
  • Five seriously injured individuals have been referred to a hospital in Lucknow.
  • The Uttar Pradesh government has announced financial assistance of ₹2.5 lakh for the seriously injured and ₹50,000 for those with minor injuries.
  • Rescue teams from SDRF, GRP, RPF, and local police are actively involved in relief operations.
“Panic ensued, and locals rushed to the site, but were unable to help due to the heavy debris.”

This unfortunate event highlights the need for stringent safety measures in construction activities to prevent such incidents in the future.

item.title: Delhi polls: Arvind Kejriwal claims BJP's CM face will be Ramesh Bidhuri; Amit Shah reacts - The Times of India
item.description:
Delhi polls: Arvind Kejriwal claims BJP's CM face will be Ramesh Bidhuri; Amit Shah reacts

Publication Date: Unknown | Source: Unknown

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has claimed that the BJP will field Ramesh Bidhuri as their Chief Ministerial candidate, prompting a reaction from Union Home Minister Amit Shah.

  • Kejriwal identifies Ramesh Bidhuri as BJP's likely CM face.
  • Amit Shah responds to the claims by Kejriwal.
  • The statement reflects ongoing political dynamics in Delhi ahead of elections.
“Kejriwal said the people are aware of who is representing BJP.”

This statement hints at the competitive nature of the upcoming elections and the strategies employed by different political parties.

item.title: Punjab AAP MLA, known for his vintage guns and cars, dies of bullet injury to head: Who was Gurpreet Gogi? - The Indian Express
item.description:
Punjab AAP MLA, known for his vintage guns and cars, dies of bullet injury to head: Who was Gurpreet Gogi?

Date: [Date of publication]
Source: [Source of publication]

Gurpreet Bassi Gogi, a 57-year-old AAP MLA from Ludhiana West, tragically died after sustaining a bullet injury to his head, which is being investigated by the police as a potential accidental shooting during the cleaning of his licensed weapon. Gogi, first elected in 2022, was known for his passion for vintage cars and weapons.

  • Gogi was a first-time MLA who won his seat on the AAP ticket.
  • He had a well-documented passion for collecting vintage weapons and luxury cars.
  • His political career began with the Congress before he joined AAP ahead of the 2022 elections.
  • Gogi was vocal about local issues and often expressed dissatisfaction with the government’s bureaucracy.
  • He was also a businessman, owning a gun shop, private hostel, and taxi service.
“Yes, I love collecting cars and weapons. I pay income tax. As long as I am working for people, it should not matter if I travel in an Ambassador or Porsche.”

Gurpreet Gogi's death marks a significant loss for his community and the AAP, reflecting the risks associated with firearm ownership and the impact of violence in political life.

item.title: 20 Workers Feared Trapped After Railway Station Roof Slab Collapses In UP's Kannauj - News18
item.description:
23 Workers Injured After Under-Construction Building Of Kannauj Railway Station Collapses

Date: January 12, 2025

Source: News18

Over two dozen workers were trapped after an under-construction roof slab of the Kannauj railway station collapsed on Saturday afternoon, resulting in at least 23 injuries, with three being serious and twenty suffering minor injuries.

  • The roof slab collapse occurred around 2:39 PM during beautification work after the shuttering failed.
  • Rescue teams, including the National Disaster Response Force, were deployed promptly.
  • Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath directed local officials to ensure the safe recovery of all trapped workers.
  • An ex-gratia payment of ₹50,000 for grievous injuries and ₹5,000 for other injuries was announced.
  • Political leaders expressed concern, with Akhilesh Yadav calling for government accountability regarding safety standards during construction.
“The incident that took place in Kannauj is very sad… Safety should have been maintained during the construction, which was neglected and this incident took place.” - Akhilesh Yadav

This incident highlights ongoing concerns regarding construction safety standards in the region.

item.title: Under-construction building collapses in UP’s Kannauj, several workers trapped - The Indian Express
item.description:
Several Trapped as Under-Construction Building Collapses in UP’s Kannauj, Rescue Operations Underway

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: The Indian Express

An under-construction building collapsed at Uttar Pradesh’s Kannauj railway station, trapping several workers under the rubble. Six workers have been rescued so far and are receiving medical treatment.

  • The collapse occurred during the shuttering of the roof.
  • District Magistrate Shubhrant Kumar Shukl is overseeing the rescue operation.
  • Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has directed officials for a safe recovery and medical treatment for those trapped.
“Our first priority is to rescue the workers who are trapped. We are using all resources at our disposal for the rescue efforts.” - District Magistrate Shubhrant Kumar Shukl

The situation remains critical as rescue operations continue to recover any remaining individuals trapped in the debris.
